intro: Amyema tahitensis, commonly known as Tahitian lily, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tahiti in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Alocasialeae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant features strap-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens. Amyema tahitensis prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
